##Wuhan first-line Milkman: We can only rely on each other

Wechat, renwumag1980

Feature Introduction, the best Chinese character report

In the 2020 Lunar New Year, the city of Wuhan was sealed off not only by local residents but also by tens of thousands of migrant workers. Instead of going home, they chose to be the defenders of the city, to keep the system going. While busy, while observing, they experienced Wuhan or large or small changes.

Hu Xuejun, a Milkman, is one of them. After the city closed, he appeared on the streets more often than usual, driving a 2.7 meter long electric refrigerator truck, delivering boxes of yogurt to local hospitals. After the new crown pneumonia outbreak, his group decided to donate dairy products to the epidemic area, they will be transported to thousands of hospitals, to the front line of the fight against the epidemic.

So far, Hu has run through seven hospitals in Wuhan. He read online that probiotics are good for you. He has a simple wish, the front-line medical staff to drink the yogurt he sent, can strengthen the resistance, save more people.

Hu Xuejun lived in Wuhan for 10 years. He likes it here, he thinks it's all good, but after the outbreak, overnight, people are so far apart, the city that used to be open becomes cold and closed. This time of year, he would return to his hometown in Shangqiu, Henan Province, to be with his parents, wife and children, and to light the New Year's fireworks. This year, he doggedly decided to stay in Wuhan and run out of Yogurt.

Here's Hu's account:

In the 2020 Lunar New Year, the city of Wuhan was sealed off not only by local residents but also by tens of thousands of migrant workers. Instead of going home, they chose to be the defenders of the city, to keep the system going. While busy, while observing, they experienced Wuhan or large or small changes.

Hu Xuejun, a Milkman, is one of them. After the city closed, he appeared on the streets more often than usual, driving a 2.7 meter long electric refrigerator truck, delivering boxes of yogurt to local hospitals. After the new crown pneumonia outbreak, his group decided to donate dairy products to the epidemic area, they will be transported to thousands of hospitals, to the front line of the fight against the epidemic.

So far, Hu has run through seven hospitals in Wuhan. He read online that probiotics are good for you. He has a simple wish, the front-line medical staff to drink the yogurt he sent, can strengthen the resistance, save more people.

Hu Xuejun lived in Wuhan for 10 years. He likes it here, he thinks it's all good, but after the outbreak, overnight, people are so far apart, the city that used to be open becomes cold and closed. This time of year, he would return to his hometown in Shangqiu, Henan Province, to be with his parents, wife and children, and to light the New Year's fireworks. This year, he doggedly decided to stay in Wuhan and run out of Yogurt.

Here's Hu's account:

By Lin Niannian

Editor | locust tree

1

On January 23rd, the city of Wuhan was closed. From that day on, we sent donated yogurt to the hospital. I went to the fourth hospital, Xinhua Hospital, gold and Silver Pool Hospital, to now have been to seven large and small hospitals.

After the closure of the city, especially the beginning of the second day, Wuhan became particularly empty. Usually when I go to deliver goods, some of the core area business circles are always stuck in traffic. Now the streets all clear, whether take the business circle or the main road, are very quiet, see no one. Occasionally see people, walking on the road is also very busy, head down, there is no communication between people, farther and farther away. People's contact with people in Wuhan was not like this before.

I drove the yogurt to the hospital cafeteria or the back office. The number of deliveries is matched by the size of the medical staff, and larger hospitals send more, like 2,000 to 3,000 people, and I send 3,000 or 4,000.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
In a hospital canteen, Mengniu front-line Staff distributed yogurt to medical staff

You go to the hospital, you're GONNA be terrified. The company gave us a mask, disinfectant, alcohol, personal protection can also. Before going out, I put on a mask and disposable gloves and keep a few masks on me. There are two kinds of masks, N95 and disposable. We terminal operators have to move things around and put on the N95, which is very difficult to breathe, so we used to wear two disposable masks and go to the area near the hospital and put on an extra layer.

One day to the Fourth Hospital Gutian Hospital district, just happened to run into a dispute. The doctor was standing there, wearing a protective suit and a mask. Next to the body lay a dozen or so people, probably relatives of the patient, some of whom rushed to tangle with the doctor and tore his protective suit. It happened right in front of my eyes, and I was very impressed.

I thought it was really hard for doctors. A doctor would hate to see a patient die. I know what it's like to lose a family member. Seeing this, I was scared, and I felt like no one was being rational in this situation.

I didn't know what else to do, deliver yogurt. When the yogurt was delivered to the doctors and nurses, they were very tired, but they were happy when they got it. They're wearing masks, they're wearing hazmat suits, they're at least a meter away from us, but you can feel the sincerity. Not the kind of courtesy we're taught, but a very sincere "thank you. ". I would say, "you're front-line fighters, and I can't help you in this business, but I just want to give you some good health. ". "That's the most I've said lately. I appreciate the doctors wanting to do their bit.

I haven't had a good rest since New Year's Eve. Do Terminal, the pressure is very big, the hospital material is also very scarce. I used to feel very tired when I carried the goods for 8 hours, but now I work 12 hours a day, or even 20 hours a day, I don't feel tired, I just want to get these yogurt to the doctors and nurses as soon as possible, they can drink it, can open up their stomachs, eat more food, build up your resistance. Sometimes from morning till eight or nine o'clock in the evening, I think I should have a rest and have a meal, but when I deliver the goods to the hospital and hear the doctor and the nurse say "thank you" , I think I should deliver the next one quickly.

Hu Xuejun

2

I am from Shangqiu, Henan Province. I came to Wuhan after graduating from university. This year is my 10th year in Wuhan. I work as a delivery Terminal for Mengniu Yogurt. I usually deliver milk from the warehouse to the store. I like here, run to and fro every day, very familiar, every place in Wuhan I feel particularly good.

On the 23rd, it was over 3:00 in the morning after the delivery, I suddenly saw someone forwarded me a message saying that Wuhan was closed to all personnel. After seeing the information, I had a hunch that there would be pressure on sales this year, so I decided not to go home for the Spring Festival.

Shang Chao's best days of business are in the new year, so we are in this node stock, this year also than in previous years more fully prepared, order rhythm, sales rhythm, are particularly good grasp. On New Year's Eve we work late every day, just want to hurry up all the delivery, can go home early. I didn't expect to see you like this.

After the children's kindergarten holiday, has first returned to the hometown, daughter-in-law with me. I told her to go home first, and she said if I didn't, she wouldn't either. On New Year's Eve, we two in Wuhan, the supermarket bought some vegetables and meat, went back to eat a meal, watched the Spring Festival evening.

After dinner, we video-chat with our parents and children back home. The Kid said he missed us so much, he cried.

It pains me to think of the child. I know young children have longing for the new year, before no matter how late, we will go home, the New Year should be lively, mom and dad are around. This year's New Year is very lonely, we did not go back, parents also feel like a lot of things are missing.

But no way, after the epidemic, the airport, the high-speed railway, were all closed. It felt like Wuhan had gone from very open to very closed. We felt like we were locked in a cage.

These days we are basically on the move, on average, I have to run about 10 terminals a day, warehouse, Shangchao, hospital, driving 2 meters 7 electric refrigerator car, cycle walking. There used to be regular working hours. After the outbreak, we worked until about one or two o'clock in the morning. We set up a temporary double bed in the warehouse. In fact, it was a piece of wood. After eating, we lay down on it for a while to sleep, or in the car to sleep for a while, up to a maximum of 4 hours sleep, with a very fragmented time to rest, almost up and work, not a few hours to work, off the concept of what time.

Every morning, noon and evening, daughter-in-law and parents take turns to call me, at least five or six a day. Especially to the hospital delivery, they are very nervous, every call is to ask me about the same question, I have the same few words. With a family behind me, I remind myself to protect myself. In the evening, my daughter-in-law and I will also with the family video, a safe. We tried not to talk about jobs or epidemics, but only about the joys of the New Year.

There are holdouts like Hu in every city, who have joined the campaign to donate to health care workers

3

It's not easy being on the front lines. We have a lot of sales assistants, in such a serious epidemic, or to stay in the mall. For example, there is a large supermarket of three shopping assistants, two have a cold, one has reached the retirement age, hanging bottles at the same time adhere to work, the other taking medicine, and called his husband to help move goods.

In another part of the mall, one of the sales assistants had been diagnosed with new coronary pneumonia. The others must have been very frightened. In that case, I was impressed that they were able to hold on to their jobs and keep cutting off the supply chain.

Now we deliver milk together only 3 people, except me, the other two are women, one is Wuhan, the other and I am the same place. They're great. They're really great. They all have their own families, but these days they are always busy, not much new year, when moving things are also very powerful. That's a lot of product on top of us. I have great admiration for these two female colleagues.

In fact, the hearts are afraid, but to work, a lot of things on the left, more forget myself. You said the problem of infection, I never dare to think, also do not think oneself can be infected, feel oneself like iron man. How am I supposed to move forward if I keep pushing myself? I can't look back.

Besides, the three of us are a small group, and everyone knows you're scared. WHO WOULDN'T BE? But if we talk about this fear, we might be influencing each other. We'd like to put aside the negative effects, and talk about how much we've done today, and who has said "thank you" to us. To put it bluntly, there are only three of us left in this group, and we have to rely on each other.

I was just a terminal salesman. I didn't think it would be this bad. I never did. At that time I was very optimistic that the country was developing so well, whether it was medicine or technology, it was developing so fast, not like five years ago or 10 years ago, right? An epidemic should be a very easy thing to deal with.

If I had known this was going to happen, I wouldn't have gone home, I would have stopped going home altogether, and I would have done a better job of preparing in advance, rather than leaving. Get more men. Get more cars. It won't be as hard on them as it is now with only three men.

But assuming that doesn't work right now, I just hope it's over soon.

Today, I heard that a long time no see shopping big sister diagnosed. As soon as we heard she had the disease, we called to see how she was doing? Do you want me to call the hospital? Do you have enough money? What can we do for you? I talk about it more, and I want to do something I can do. I never thought about how we could keep her at arm's length when she was sick.

Although not Wuhan people, but to see Wuhan into this, I feel very sad. I feel like we're on an island. People who are not in Wuhan may not realize this, but here, people think more about how to help those who are sick. They were also helpless, and no one wanted pneumonia, wanted to be in bad shape.

When we're finished, I'd like to find some fried rice for my colleagues, and see if some of the street shops have it. Now there is no food in Wuhan, many fast food has stopped, these days we are prepared in the car instant noodles, ham sausage, brine eggs, or the supermarket to buy some bread, every meal is to deal with. After such a long time, I feel sick, I really can't eat instant noodles and bread any more. I just want to get fried rice, so we can improve our food.

At this point, we can't go down. We have to deliver yogurt to the hospital tomorrow. Doctors and nurses work day and night, guarding lives; we work overtime, guarding them.

Mengniu in Suzhou and other cities have also carried out donations, dairy products must be handed over to the hands of medical staff

Haven't you seen enough?

LONG-PRESS QR code to follow "people" on Wechat
